name: Ethiopian Empire
summary: The Ethiopian Empire, also formerly known by the exonym Abyssinia, was an empire that historically spanned the geographical area of present-day Ethiopia and Eritrea.

name: Funj Sultanate
summary: The Funj Sultanate, also known as the Sultanate of Sinnar, was a monarchy in what is now Sudan, northwestern Ethiopia and western Eritrea.

name: Adal Sultanate
summary: The Adal Sultanate was a medieval Muslim state located in the Horn of Africa, centered in the city of Harar.

name: Kingdom of Aksum
summary: The Kingdom of Aksum was an ancient kingdom centered in Northern Ethiopia and Eritrea. It was a major trading empire.

name: Sultanate of Ifat
summary: The Sultanate of Ifat was a medieval Muslim state in the Horn of Africa, located in eastern Ethiopia.

name: Kingdom of Kaffa
summary: The Kingdom of Kaffa was a kingdom located in what is now Ethiopia. It was known for its coffee production.

name: Kingdom of Damot
summary: The Kingdom of Damot was a medieval kingdom in southern Ethiopia, eventually incorporated into the Ethiopian Empire.

name: Sultanate of Harar
summary: The Sultanate of Harar was a Muslim state centered in the city of Harar, known as a center of Islamic learning.
